comments.body: Maybe that would be a good idea to add those instructions in the script itself? The script could replace `x.y.z` to the correct version, helping the maintainer even more.

Hmmm, thought I responded but I guess it got lost.

I experimented with including all the git stuff inside the script but for some reason checking out the branch didn't work right away. The more I thought about it the more I realized it might not make sense to automate the git stuff since you also need to fetch the remote and rebase with whitespace fix... and figured it might be better to not do any of the git stuff and keep it as a separate task
